div1.p:
United States Consulate
St Paul de Loanda
S.W.C. Africa

L de R. de Verge
To Dept of State
Washington D.C.

Subject
Request for blanks Forms, Flags, Boat, Flag staff &a

Encloses.
Statement of the conditions in which the Consular archives &a are.

opener.dateline:
United States Consulate
St Paul de Loanda
June 29th 1882.

div1.p:
Sir
I have the honor most respectfully to request that the U.S. Govt. may furnish this consulate with a boat oars and sail. My seasons for asking such are: that a boat here is the most essential piece of furniture this consulate could have, as to travel by land to the places under this jurisdiction, in a hammock cost too much, and being a seafearing man; I will be able to manage a boat to any point of my consular supervision with more speed and less expenses, when such is required for the benefits of Americans and the govt I have the honor to represent here.

closer.salute:
I have the honor to be
Sir
Your obedient servant
closer.signed:
L. de R. du Verge
U.S. Consul
